content.description: Start at the left, and traverse the sweet lip right and up to the prow, then top out.
content.location: If walking from the Welcome Boulder away from the train tracks on the yellow trail for a couple hundred feet, this will be on the left, just around the corner (further from the yellow trail) from First Place Loser.

content.description: Climb an easy finger crack. A few good finger locks and a ring lock lead to a jug and topout. There are small, positive feet. It has fun movement but is way too short.
content.protection: It has a good landing. A pad is optional.
content.location: This is just off of the yellow trail in a short wall.

content.description: Start down low on the sidepulls in the crack. Work straight up the prow. The first move was the crux for me. This is a quality line.
content.location: It is to the right of Traverse of Mirkwood. Or if you’re facing First Place Loser, this is behind you and to your left.

content.description: Layback the crack to an easy topout.
content.location: When approaching from the Welcome Boulders, there will be a large block in front of you. This problem is just to the right of this.

content.description: This is a collection of boulders in a small area. They have good quality granite holds and some of Garfield Woods harder problems as well as some easy ones.
